trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning FAQ | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning FAQ | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning introduction: FAQ covering billing, capabilities, and limitations of a cloud service for streamlined predictive modeling.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning introduction: FAQ covering billing, capabilities, and limitations of a cloud service for streamlined predictive modeling.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ): Billing, capabilities, limitations, and support
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ): Billing, capabilities, limitations, and support

trans-unit.source: This FAQ answers questions about Azure Machine Learning, a cloud service for predictive modeling and operationalizing solutions through web services.
trans-unit.target: This FAQ answers questions about Azure Machine Learning, a cloud service for predictive modeling and operationalizing solutions through web services.

trans-unit.source: This FAQ covers questions about using the service, including the billing model, capabilities, limitations, and support.
trans-unit.target: This FAQ covers questions about using the service, including the billing model, capabilities, limitations, and support.

trans-unit.source: General questions
trans-unit.target: General questions

trans-unit.source: What is Azure Machine Learning?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure Machine Learning?

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning is a fully managed service that you can use to create, test, operate, and manage predictive analytic solutions in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning is a fully managed service that you can use to create, test, operate, and manage predictive analytic solutions in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: With only a browser, you can sign-in, upload data, and immediately start machine learning experiments.
trans-unit.target: With only a browser, you can sign-in, upload data, and immediately start machine learning experiments.

trans-unit.source: Drag-and-drop predictive modeling, a large pallet of modules, and a library of starting templates makes common machine learning tasks simple and quick.
trans-unit.target: Drag-and-drop predictive modeling, a large pallet of modules, and a library of starting templates makes common machine learning tasks simple and quick.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Azure Machine Learning service overview](/services/machine-learning/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Azure Machine Learning service overview](/services/machine-learning/).

trans-unit.source: For a machine learning introduction covering key terminology and concepts, see [Introduction to Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-what-is-machine-learning.md).
trans-unit.target: For a machine learning introduction covering key terminology and concepts, see [Introduction to Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-what-is-machine-learning.md).

trans-unit.source: What is Machine Learning Studio?
trans-unit.target: What is Machine Learning Studio?

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio is a workbench environment you access through a web browser.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio is a workbench environment you access through a web browser.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio hosts a pallet of modules with a visual composition interface that enables you to build an end-to-end, data-science workflow in the form of an experiment.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio hosts a pallet of modules with a visual composition interface that enables you to build an end-to-end, data-science workflow in the form of an experiment.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Machine Learning Studio, see [What is Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-what-is-ml-studio.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Machine Learning Studio, see [What is Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-what-is-ml-studio.md)

trans-unit.source: What is the Machine Learning API service?
trans-unit.target: What is the Machine Learning API service?

trans-unit.source: The Machine Learning API service enables you to deploy predictive models built in Machine Learning Studio as scalable, fault-tolerant, web services.
trans-unit.target: The Machine Learning API service enables you to deploy predictive models built in Machine Learning Studio as scalable, fault-tolerant, web services.

trans-unit.source: The web services created by the Machine Learning API service are REST APIs that provide an interface for communication between external applications and your predictive analytics models.
trans-unit.target: The web services created by the Machine Learning API service are REST APIs that provide an interface for communication between external applications and your predictive analytics models.

trans-unit.source: See [Connect to a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-connect-to-azure-machine-learning-web-service.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Connect to a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-connect-to-azure-machine-learning-web-service.md) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Billing questions
trans-unit.target: Billing questions

trans-unit.source: How does Machine Learning billing work?
trans-unit.target: How does Machine Learning billing work?

trans-unit.source: For billing and pricing information, see [Machine Learning Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/machine-learning/).
trans-unit.target: For billing and pricing information, see [Machine Learning Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/machine-learning/).

trans-unit.source: Does Machine Learning have a free trial?
trans-unit.target: Does Machine Learning have a free trial?

trans-unit.source: When you sign up for an Azure free trial, you can try any Azure services for a month.
trans-unit.target: When you sign up for an Azure free trial, you can try any Azure services for a month.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Azure free trial, visit [Azure Free Trial FAQ](/pricing/free-trial-faq/).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Azure free trial, visit [Azure Free Trial FAQ](/pricing/free-trial-faq/).

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio questions
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio questions

trans-unit.source: Creating an experiment
trans-unit.target: Creating an experiment

trans-unit.source: **Is there version control or Git integration for experiment graphs?**
trans-unit.target: **Is there version control or Git integration for experiment graphs?**

trans-unit.source: No, however each time an experiment is run that version of the graph is kept and cannot be modified by other users.
trans-unit.target: No, however each time an experiment is run that version of the graph is kept and cannot be modified by other users.

trans-unit.source: Importing and exporting data for Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Importing and exporting data for Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: **What data sources does Machine Learning support?**
trans-unit.target: **What data sources does Machine Learning support?**

trans-unit.source: Data can be loaded into Machine Learning Studio in one of two ways: by uploading local files as a dataset or by using a reader module to import data.
trans-unit.target: Data can be loaded into Machine Learning Studio in one of two ways: by uploading local files as a dataset or by using a reader module to import data.

trans-unit.source: Local files can be uploaded by adding new datasets in Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: Local files can be uploaded by adding new datasets in Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: See [Import training data into Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-import-data.md) to learn more about supported file formats.
trans-unit.target: See [Import training data into Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-import-data.md) to learn more about supported file formats.

trans-unit.source: How large can the data set be for my modules?
trans-unit.target: How large can the data set be for my modules?

trans-unit.source: Modules in Machine Learning Studio support datasets of up to 10 GB of dense numerical data for common use cases.
trans-unit.target: Modules in Machine Learning Studio support datasets of up to 10 GB of dense numerical data for common use cases.

trans-unit.source: If a module takes more than one input, the 10 GB is the total of all input sizes.
trans-unit.target: If a module takes more than one input, the 10 GB is the total of all input sizes.

trans-unit.source: You can also sample larger datasets via Hive or Azure SQL Database queries, or by Learning by Counts pre-processing, before ingestion.
trans-unit.target: You can also sample larger datasets via Hive or Azure SQL Database queries, or by Learning by Counts pre-processing, before ingestion.

trans-unit.source: The following types of data can expand into larger datasets during feature normalization, and are limited to less than 10 GB:
trans-unit.target: The following types of data can expand into larger datasets during feature normalization, and are limited to less than 10 GB:

trans-unit.source: Sparse
trans-unit.target: Sparse

trans-unit.source: Categorical
trans-unit.target: Categorical

trans-unit.source: Strings
trans-unit.target: Strings

trans-unit.source: Binary data
trans-unit.target: Binary data

trans-unit.source: The following modules are limited to datasets less than 10GB:
trans-unit.target: The following modules are limited to datasets less than 10GB:

trans-unit.source: Recommender modules
trans-unit.target: Recommender modules

trans-unit.source: SMOTE module
trans-unit.target: SMOTE module

trans-unit.source: Scripting modules: R, Python, SQL
trans-unit.target: Scripting modules: R, Python, SQL

trans-unit.source: Modules where the output data size can be larger than input data size, such as Join or Feature Hashing.
trans-unit.target: Modules where the output data size can be larger than input data size, such as Join or Feature Hashing.

trans-unit.source: Cross-validation, Sweep Parameters, Ordinal Regression and One-vs-All Multiclass, when number of iterations is very large.
trans-unit.target: Cross-validation, Sweep Parameters, Ordinal Regression and One-vs-All Multiclass, when number of iterations is very large.

trans-unit.source: For datasets larger than a few GB, you should upload data to Azure storage or Azure SQL Database or use HDInsight, rather than directly uploading from local file.
trans-unit.target: For datasets larger than a few GB, you should upload data to Azure storage or Azure SQL Database or use HDInsight, rather than directly uploading from local file.

trans-unit.source: What are the limits for data upload?
trans-unit.target: What are the limits for data upload?

trans-unit.source: For datasets larger than a couple GB, upload data to Azure storage or Azure SQL Database or use HDInsight, rather than directly uploading from local file.
trans-unit.target: For datasets larger than a couple GB, upload data to Azure storage or Azure SQL Database or use HDInsight, rather than directly uploading from local file.

trans-unit.source: Can I read data from Amazon S3?
trans-unit.target: Can I read data from Amazon S3?

trans-unit.source: If you have a small amount of data and want to expose it via an http URL, then you can use the [Reader][reader] module.
trans-unit.target: If you have a small amount of data and want to expose it via an http URL, then you can use the [Reader][reader] module.

trans-unit.source: For any larger amounts of data to transfer it to Azure Storage first and then use the [Reader][reader] module to bring it into your experiment.
trans-unit.target: For any larger amounts of data to transfer it to Azure Storage first and then use the [Reader][reader] module to bring it into your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Is there a built-in image input capability?
trans-unit.target: Is there a built-in image input capability?

trans-unit.source: You can learn about image input capability in the [Image Reader][image-reader] reference.
trans-unit.target: You can learn about image input capability in the [Image Reader][image-reader] reference.

trans-unit.source: Modules
trans-unit.target: Modules

trans-unit.source: The algorithm, data source, data format, or data transformation operation I am looking for isn't in Azure ML Studio, what are my options?
trans-unit.target: The algorithm, data source, data format, or data transformation operation I am looking for isn't in Azure ML Studio, what are my options?

trans-unit.source: You can visit the [user feedback forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=404231) to see features requests that we are tracking.
trans-unit.target: You can visit the [user feedback forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=404231) to see features requests that we are tracking.

trans-unit.source: Add your vote to this request if a capability you are looking for has already been requested.
trans-unit.target: Add your vote to this request if a capability you are looking for has already been requested.

trans-unit.source: If the capability you are looking for does not exist, create a new request.
trans-unit.target: If the capability you are looking for does not exist, create a new request.

trans-unit.source: You can view the status of your request in this forum too.
trans-unit.target: You can view the status of your request in this forum too.

trans-unit.source: We track this list closely and update the status of feature availability frequently.
trans-unit.target: We track this list closely and update the status of feature availability frequently.

trans-unit.source: In addition with the built-in support for R and Python, custom transformations can be created as needed.
trans-unit.target: In addition with the built-in support for R and Python, custom transformations can be created as needed.

trans-unit.source: Can I bring my existing code into ML Studio?
trans-unit.target: Can I bring my existing code into ML Studio?

trans-unit.source: Yes, you can bring your existing R code in ML Studio and run it in the same experiment with Azure Machine Learning-provided learners and publish this as a web service via Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: Yes, you can bring your existing R code in ML Studio and run it in the same experiment with Azure Machine Learning-provided learners and publish this as a web service via Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: See [Extend your experiment with R ](machine-learning-extend-your-experiment-with-r.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Extend your experiment with R ](machine-learning-extend-your-experiment-with-r.md).

trans-unit.source: Is it possible to use something like [PMML](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predictive_Model_Markup_Language) to define a model?
trans-unit.target: Is it possible to use something like [PMML](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predictive_Model_Markup_Language) to define a model?

trans-unit.source: No, that is not supported, however custom R and Python code can be used to define a module.
trans-unit.target: No, that is not supported, however custom R and Python code can be used to define a module.

trans-unit.source: Data processing
trans-unit.target: Data processing

trans-unit.source: **Is there an ability to visualize data (beyond R visualizations) interactively within the experiment?**
trans-unit.target: **Is there an ability to visualize data (beyond R visualizations) interactively within the experiment?**

trans-unit.source: By clicking on the output of a module you can visualize the data and get statistics.
trans-unit.target: By clicking on the output of a module you can visualize the data and get statistics.

trans-unit.source: When previewing results or data in the browser, the number of rows and columns is limited, why?
trans-unit.target: When previewing results or data in the browser, the number of rows and columns is limited, why?

trans-unit.source: Since the data is being transmitted to the browser and may be large, the data size is limited to prevent slowing down the ML studio.
trans-unit.target: Since the data is being transmitted to the browser and may be large, the data size is limited to prevent slowing down the ML studio.

trans-unit.source: It is better to download the data/result and use Excel or another tool to visualize the entire data.
trans-unit.target: It is better to download the data/result and use Excel or another tool to visualize the entire data.

trans-unit.source: Algorithms
trans-unit.target: Algorithms

trans-unit.source: **What existing algorithms are supported in Machine Learning Studio?**
trans-unit.target: **What existing algorithms are supported in Machine Learning Studio?**

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio provides state of the art algorithms, such as Scalable Boosted Decision trees, Bayesian Recommendation systems, Deep Neural Networks, and Decision Jungles developed at Microsoft Research.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio provides state of the art algorithms, such as Scalable Boosted Decision trees, Bayesian Recommendation systems, Deep Neural Networks, and Decision Jungles developed at Microsoft Research.

trans-unit.source: Scalable open-source machine learning packages like Vowpal Wabbit are also included.
trans-unit.target: Scalable open-source machine learning packages like Vowpal Wabbit are also included.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio supports machine learning algorithms for multiclass and binary classification, regression, and clustering.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio supports machine learning algorithms for multiclass and binary classification, regression, and clustering.

trans-unit.source: See the complete list of [Machine Learning Modules][machine-learning-modules].
trans-unit.target: See the complete list of [Machine Learning Modules][machine-learning-modules].

trans-unit.source: Do you automatically suggest the right Machine Learning algorithm to use for my data?
trans-unit.target: Do you automatically suggest the right Machine Learning algorithm to use for my data?

trans-unit.source: No, however there are a number of ways in Machine Learning Studio to compare the results of each algorithm to determine the right one for your problem.
trans-unit.target: No, however there are a number of ways in Machine Learning Studio to compare the results of each algorithm to determine the right one for your problem.

trans-unit.source: **Do you have any guidelines on picking one algorithm over another for the provided algorithms?**
trans-unit.target: **Do you have any guidelines on picking one algorithm over another for the provided algorithms?**

trans-unit.source: See [How to choose an algorithm ](machine-learning-algorithm-choice.md).
trans-unit.target: See [How to choose an algorithm ](machine-learning-algorithm-choice.md).

trans-unit.source: Are the provided algorithms written in R or Python?
trans-unit.target: Are the provided algorithms written in R or Python?

trans-unit.source: No, these algorithms are mostly written in compiled languages to provide higher performance.
trans-unit.target: No, these algorithms are mostly written in compiled languages to provide higher performance.

trans-unit.source: Are any details of the algorithms provided?
trans-unit.target: Are any details of the algorithms provided?

trans-unit.source: The documentation provides some information about the algorithms, and the parameters provided for tuning are described to optimize the algorithm for your use.
trans-unit.target: The documentation provides some information about the algorithms, and the parameters provided for tuning are described to optimize the algorithm for your use.

trans-unit.source: Is there any support for online learning?
trans-unit.target: Is there any support for online learning?

trans-unit.source: No, currently only programmatic retraining is supported.
trans-unit.target: No, currently only programmatic retraining is supported.

trans-unit.source: Can I visualize the layers of a Neural Net Model using the built-in Module?
trans-unit.target: Can I visualize the layers of a Neural Net Model using the built-in Module?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Can I create my own modules in C# or some other language?
trans-unit.target: Can I create my own modules in C# or some other language?

trans-unit.source: Currently new custom modules can only be created in R.
trans-unit.target: Currently new custom modules can only be created in R.

trans-unit.source: R module
trans-unit.target: R module

trans-unit.source: **What R packages are available in Machine Learning Studio?**
trans-unit.target: **What R packages are available in Machine Learning Studio?**

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio supports 400+ R packages today, and this list is constantly growing.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio supports 400+ R packages today, and this list is constantly growing.

trans-unit.source: See [Extend your experiment with R ](machine-learning-extend-your-experiment-with-r.md) to learn how to get a list of supported R packages.
trans-unit.target: See [Extend your experiment with R ](machine-learning-extend-your-experiment-with-r.md) to learn how to get a list of supported R packages.

trans-unit.source: If the package you want is not in this list, provide the name of package at [user feedback forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=404231).
trans-unit.target: If the package you want is not in this list, provide the name of package at [user feedback forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=404231).

trans-unit.source: Is it possible to build a custom R module?
trans-unit.target: Is it possible to build a custom R module?

trans-unit.source: Yes, see [Author custom R modules in Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-custom-r-modules.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: Yes, see [Author custom R modules in Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-custom-r-modules.md) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Is there a REPL environment for R?
trans-unit.target: Is there a REPL environment for R?

trans-unit.source: No, there is no REPL environment for R in the studio.
trans-unit.target: No, there is no REPL environment for R in the studio.

trans-unit.source: Python module
trans-unit.target: Python module

trans-unit.source: Is it possible to build a custom Python module?
trans-unit.target: Is it possible to build a custom Python module?

trans-unit.source: Not currently, but with the standard Python module or a set of them the same result can be achieved.
trans-unit.target: Not currently, but with the standard Python module or a set of them the same result can be achieved.

trans-unit.source: Is there a REPL environment for Python?
trans-unit.target: Is there a REPL environment for Python?

trans-unit.source: You can use the Jupyter Notebooks in the Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Jupyter Notebooks in the Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Introducing Jupyter Notebooks in Azure ML Studio] (http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2015/07/24/introducing-jupyter-notebooks-in-azure-ml-studio.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Introducing Jupyter Notebooks in Azure ML Studio] (http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2015/07/24/introducing-jupyter-notebooks-in-azure-ml-studio.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Web service
trans-unit.target: Web service

trans-unit.source: Retrainining Models Programmatically
trans-unit.target: Retrainining Models Programmatically

trans-unit.source: **How do I Retrain AzureML Models programmatically?**
trans-unit.target: **How do I Retrain AzureML Models programmatically?**

trans-unit.source: Use the Retraining APIs.
trans-unit.target: Use the Retraining APIs.

trans-unit.source: Sample code is available [here](https://azuremlretrain.codeplex.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sample code is available [here](https://azuremlretrain.codeplex.com/).

trans-unit.source: Create
trans-unit.target: Create

trans-unit.source: **Can I deploy the model locally or in an application without an internet connection?**
trans-unit.target: **Can I deploy the model locally or in an application without an internet connection?**

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Is there a baseline latency that is expected for all web services?
trans-unit.target: Is there a baseline latency that is expected for all web services?

trans-unit.source: See the [Azure subscription limits](../azure-subscription-service-limits.md)
trans-unit.target: See the [Azure subscription limits](../azure-subscription-service-limits.md)

trans-unit.source: Use
trans-unit.target: Use

trans-unit.source: **When would I want to run my predictive model as a Batch Execution service versus a Request Response service?**
trans-unit.target: **When would I want to run my predictive model as a Batch Execution service versus a Request Response service?**

trans-unit.source: The Request Response service (RRS) is a low-latency, high-scale web service that is used to provide an interface to stateless models that are created and published from the experimentation environment.
trans-unit.target: The Request Response service (RRS) is a low-latency, high-scale web service that is used to provide an interface to stateless models that are created and published from the experimentation environment.

trans-unit.source: The Batch Execution service (BES) is a service for asynchronously scoring a batch of data records.
trans-unit.target: The Batch Execution service (BES) is a service for asynchronously scoring a batch of data records.

trans-unit.source: The input for BES is similar to data input used in RRS.
trans-unit.target: The input for BES is similar to data input used in RRS.

trans-unit.source: The main difference is that BES reads a block of records from a variety of sources, such as the Blob service and Table service in Azure, Azure SQL Database, HDInsight (hive query), and HTTP sources.
trans-unit.target: The main difference is that BES reads a block of records from a variety of sources, such as the Blob service and Table service in Azure, Azure SQL Database, HDInsight (hive query), and HTTP sources.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to consume Machine Learning web services](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to consume Machine Learning web services](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).

trans-unit.source: How do I update the model for the deployed web service?
trans-unit.target: How do I update the model for the deployed web service?

trans-unit.source: Updating a predictive model for an already deployed service is as simple as modifying and re-running the experiment used to author and save the trained model.
trans-unit.target: Updating a predictive model for an already deployed service is as simple as modifying and re-running the experiment used to author and save the trained model.

trans-unit.source: Once you have new version of the trained model available, ML Studio will ask you if you want to update your staging web service.
trans-unit.target: Once you have new version of the trained model available, ML Studio will ask you if you want to update your staging web service.

trans-unit.source: After the update is applied to the staging web service, the same update will become available for you to apply to the production web service as well.
trans-unit.target: After the update is applied to the staging web service, the same update will become available for you to apply to the production web service as well.

trans-unit.source: See [Publish a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md) for details on how to update a deployed web service.
trans-unit.target: See [Publish a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md) for details on how to update a deployed web service.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Retraining APIs.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Retraining APIs.

trans-unit.source: The sample code is available [here](https://azuremlretrain.codeplex.com/).
trans-unit.target: The sample code is available [here](https://azuremlretrain.codeplex.com/).

trans-unit.source: How do I monitor my Web service deployed in production?
trans-unit.target: How do I monitor my Web service deployed in production?

trans-unit.source: Once a predictive model has been put into production, you can monitor it from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Once a predictive model has been put into production, you can monitor it from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Each deployed service has its own dashboard, where you can see monitoring information for that service.
trans-unit.target: Each deployed service has its own dashboard, where you can see monitoring information for that service.

trans-unit.source: Is there a place where I can see the output of my RRS/BES?
trans-unit.target: Is there a place where I can see the output of my RRS/BES?

trans-unit.source: For RRS, the web service response is typically where you see the result.
trans-unit.target: For RRS, the web service response is typically where you see the result.

trans-unit.source: You can also write it a blob.
trans-unit.target: You can also write it a blob.

trans-unit.source: For BES, the output is written to a blob by default.
trans-unit.target: For BES, the output is written to a blob by default.

trans-unit.source: You can also write the output to a database or table using the Writer module.
trans-unit.target: You can also write the output to a database or table using the Writer module.

trans-unit.source: **Can I create web services only from models created in the Studio?
trans-unit.target: **Can I create web services only from models created in the Studio?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: You can also create web services directly from Jupyter Notebooks, and RStudio.
trans-unit.target: You can also create web services directly from Jupyter Notebooks, and RStudio.

trans-unit.source: Scalability
trans-unit.target: Scalability

trans-unit.source: What is the scalability of the web service?
trans-unit.target: What is the scalability of the web service?

trans-unit.source: Currently, the maximum is 20 concurrent requests per end point, though it can scale to 10,000 end points.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the maximum is 20 concurrent requests per end point, though it can scale to 10,000 end points.

trans-unit.source: This translates to 4,800 concurrent request if we use every resource (300 workers).
trans-unit.target: This translates to 4,800 concurrent request if we use every resource (300 workers).

trans-unit.source: Are R jobs spread across nodes?
trans-unit.target: Are R jobs spread across nodes?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: How much data can I train on?
trans-unit.target: How much data can I train on?

trans-unit.source: Modules in Machine Learning Studio support datasets of up to 10 GB of dense numerical data for common use cases.
trans-unit.target: Modules in Machine Learning Studio support datasets of up to 10 GB of dense numerical data for common use cases.

trans-unit.source: If a module takes more than one input, the 10 GB is the total of all input sizes.
trans-unit.target: If a module takes more than one input, the 10 GB is the total of all input sizes.

trans-unit.source: You can also sample larger datasets via Hive or Azure SQL Database queries, or by Learning by Counts pre-processing, before ingestion.
trans-unit.target: You can also sample larger datasets via Hive or Azure SQL Database queries, or by Learning by Counts pre-processing, before ingestion.

trans-unit.source: The following types of data can expand into larger datasets during feature normalization, and are limited to less than 10 GB:
trans-unit.target: The following types of data can expand into larger datasets during feature normalization, and are limited to less than 10 GB:

trans-unit.source: Sparse
trans-unit.target: Sparse

trans-unit.source: Categorical
trans-unit.target: Categorical

trans-unit.source: Strings
trans-unit.target: Strings

trans-unit.source: Binary data
trans-unit.target: Binary data

trans-unit.source: The following modules are limited to datasets less than 10GB:
trans-unit.target: The following modules are limited to datasets less than 10GB:

trans-unit.source: Recommender modules
trans-unit.target: Recommender modules

trans-unit.source: SMOTE module
trans-unit.target: SMOTE module

trans-unit.source: Scripting modules: R, Python, SQL
trans-unit.target: Scripting modules: R, Python, SQL

trans-unit.source: Modules where the output data size can be larger than input data size, such as Join or Feature Hashing.
trans-unit.target: Modules where the output data size can be larger than input data size, such as Join or Feature Hashing.

trans-unit.source: Cross-validation, Sweep Parameters, Ordinal Regression and One-vs-All Multiclass, when number of iterations is very large.
trans-unit.target: Cross-validation, Sweep Parameters, Ordinal Regression and One-vs-All Multiclass, when number of iterations is very large.

trans-unit.source: For datasets larger than a few GB, you should upload data to Azure storage or Azure SQL Database or use HDInsight, rather than directly uploading from local file.
trans-unit.target: For datasets larger than a few GB, you should upload data to Azure storage or Azure SQL Database or use HDInsight, rather than directly uploading from local file.

trans-unit.source: Are there any vector size limitations?
trans-unit.target: Are there any vector size limitations?

trans-unit.source: Rows and columns are each limited to the .NET limitation of Max Int: 2,147,483,647.
trans-unit.target: Rows and columns are each limited to the .NET limitation of Max Int: 2,147,483,647.

trans-unit.source: Can the VM size that this is being run on be adjusted?
trans-unit.target: Can the VM size that this is being run on be adjusted?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: Security and availability
trans-unit.target: Security and availability

trans-unit.source: Who has access to the http end point for the web service deployed in production by default?
trans-unit.target: Who has access to the http end point for the web service deployed in production by default?

trans-unit.source: How do I restrict access to the end point?
trans-unit.target: How do I restrict access to the end point?

trans-unit.source: After a web service is published, we create a default endpoint for that service.
trans-unit.target: After a web service is published, we create a default endpoint for that service.

trans-unit.source: That default endpoint is deployed to production and can be called using its API Key.
trans-unit.target: That default endpoint is deployed to production and can be called using its API Key.

trans-unit.source: Additional endpoints can be added with their own keys from the Azure Portal or programmatically using the Web Service Management APIs.
trans-unit.target: Additional endpoints can be added with their own keys from the Azure Portal or programmatically using the Web Service Management APIs.

trans-unit.source: Access keys are needed to make calls to the web service in production and staging.
trans-unit.target: Access keys are needed to make calls to the web service in production and staging.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Connect to a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-connect-to-azure-machine-learning-web-service.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Connect to a Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-connect-to-azure-machine-learning-web-service.md).

trans-unit.source: What happens if my Storage Account cannot be found?
trans-unit.target: What happens if my Storage Account cannot be found?

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio relies on a user supplied Azure Storage Account to save intermediary data when executing the workflow.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio relies on a user supplied Azure Storage Account to save intermediary data when executing the workflow.

trans-unit.source: This Storage Account is provided to Machine Learning Studio at the time a workspace is created.
trans-unit.target: This Storage Account is provided to Machine Learning Studio at the time a workspace is created.

trans-unit.source: After the workspace is created, if the Storage Account is deleted and can no longer be found, that workspace will stop functioning and all experiments in that workspace will fail.
trans-unit.target: After the workspace is created, if the Storage Account is deleted and can no longer be found, that workspace will stop functioning and all experiments in that workspace will fail.

trans-unit.source: If you accidentally deleted the Storage Account, the only way to recover from it is to recreate that Storage Account with the exact same name in the exact same Region as the deleted one.
trans-unit.target: If you accidentally deleted the Storage Account, the only way to recover from it is to recreate that Storage Account with the exact same name in the exact same Region as the deleted one.

trans-unit.source: After that, please re-sync the Access Key.
trans-unit.target: After that, please re-sync the Access Key.

trans-unit.source: **What happens if my Storage Account Access Key is out of sync?**
trans-unit.target: **What happens if my Storage Account Access Key is out of sync?**

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio relies on a user supplied Azure Storage Account to save intermediary data when executing the workflow.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio relies on a user supplied Azure Storage Account to save intermediary data when executing the workflow.

trans-unit.source: This Storage Account is provided to Machine Learning Studio at the time a workspace is created and the Access Keys are associated with that workspace.
trans-unit.target: This Storage Account is provided to Machine Learning Studio at the time a workspace is created and the Access Keys are associated with that workspace.

trans-unit.source: After the workspace is created, if the Access keys are changed, that workspace can no longer access the Storage Account, and it will stop functioning and all experiments in that workspace will fail.
trans-unit.target: After the workspace is created, if the Access keys are changed, that workspace can no longer access the Storage Account, and it will stop functioning and all experiments in that workspace will fail.

trans-unit.source: If you have changed Storage Account Access Keys, please ensure to resync the Access Keys in the workspace setting in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: If you have changed Storage Account Access Keys, please ensure to resync the Access Keys in the workspace setting in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Azure Marketplace
trans-unit.target: Azure Marketplace

trans-unit.source: See the [FAQ for publishing and using apps in the Machine Learning Marketplace](machine-learning-marketplace-faq.md)
trans-unit.target: See the [FAQ for publishing and using apps in the Machine Learning Marketplace](machine-learning-marketplace-faq.md)

trans-unit.source: Support and training
trans-unit.target: Support and training

trans-unit.source: Where can I get training for Azure ML?
trans-unit.target: Where can I get training for Azure ML?

trans-unit.source: [Azure Machine Learning Documentation Center](/services/machine-learning/) hosts video tutorials as well as how-to guides.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Machine Learning Documentation Center](/services/machine-learning/) hosts video tutorials as well as how-to guides.

trans-unit.source: These step-by-step guides provide an introduction to the services and walk through the data science life cycle of importing data, cleaning data, building predictive models and deploying them in production with Azure ML.
trans-unit.target: These step-by-step guides provide an introduction to the services and walk through the data science life cycle of importing data, cleaning data, building predictive models and deploying them in production with Azure ML.

trans-unit.source: We will be adding new material to Machine Learning Center on an ongoing basis.
trans-unit.target: We will be adding new material to Machine Learning Center on an ongoing basis.

trans-unit.source: You can submit requests for additional learning material on Machine Learning Center at [user feedback forum](https://windowsazure.uservoice.com/forums/257792-machine-learning).
trans-unit.target: You can submit requests for additional learning material on Machine Learning Center at [user feedback forum](https://windowsazure.uservoice.com/forums/257792-machine-learning).

trans-unit.source: You can also find training at [Microsoft Virtual Academy](http://www.microsoftvirtualacademy.com/training-courses/getting-started-with-microsoft-azure-machine-learning)
trans-unit.target: You can also find training at [Microsoft Virtual Academy](http://www.microsoftvirtualacademy.com/training-courses/getting-started-with-microsoft-azure-machine-learning)

trans-unit.source: How do I get support for Azure Machine Learning?
trans-unit.target: How do I get support for Azure Machine Learning?

trans-unit.source: To get technical support for Azure Machine Learning, go to [Azure Support](/support/options/) select **Machine Learning**.
trans-unit.target: To get technical support for Azure Machine Learning, go to [Azure Support](/support/options/) select **Machine Learning**.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning also has a community forum on MSDN, where you can ask Azure ML related questions.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning also has a community forum on MSDN, where you can ask Azure ML related questions.

trans-unit.source: The forum is monitored by the Azure ML team.
trans-unit.target: The forum is monitored by the Azure ML team.

trans-unit.source: Visit [Azure Forum](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home?forum=MachineLearning).
trans-unit.target: Visit [Azure Forum](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home?forum=MachineLearning).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
